baseline_groups.claim_summary: Land rental subsidies increase agricultural value added (the primary outcome) via ITT estimation.
baseline_groups.notes: Coefficient: 19.84 (SE~14, p=0.15). Not significant at conventional levels. Strata and round FE, farmer-clustered SE, baseline controls.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Land rental subsidies increase land cultivation (extensive margin).
baseline_groups.notes: Coefficient: 0.031 (p=0.14). First-stage mechanism: does subsidy increase land use?

global_notes: Paper: Land Rental Subsidies and Agricultural Productivity by Acampora, Casaburi, Willis (AER). RCT with rental subsidy and cash drop arms vs control. ITT analysis with strata + round FE. Primary outcome (value added) is not significant at baseline (p=0.15). The cash drop arm provides a comparison treatment. First stage and mechanism specs confirm subsidy increases land rental. 69 total specs.
